articles.title: Fossilized Footprints Push Back Date of Human Arrival in Americas - ExtremeTech
articles.description: A discovery of preserved human footprints in White Sands National Park in New Mexico has pushed the timeline back by thousands of years.
articles.content: Scientists believe that the first beings we could call modern humans emerged in Africa some 300,000 years ago. Over the millennia, Homo sapiens expanded across the world but didn’t reach North Americ… [+2348 chars]

articles.title: Biden gets Covid-19 vaccine booster shot - TODAY - TODAYonline
articles.description: WASHINGTON — United States (US) President Joe Biden received a Covid-19 vaccine booster on Monday (Sept 27) and told Americans still resisting the shots that they are damaging the country.
